title: PSA: If you want to rake in some easy wins as Morde, play him Bot lane
body:
[](https://s-media-cache-ak0.pinimg.com/originals/ac/6d/bb/ac6dbb5eb4797be434953f5764374ee8.jpg)
With the current Meta favoring snowballing and top lane being infested with carry picks I've grown quite fond of a different style of Mordekaiser:

#AP Carry Mordekaiser

Playing him bot lane, like he was reworked to do so by none other than CertainlyT, seems like the best course of action currently if you really want to climb in ranked.
Every high elo Mordekaiser plays him Bot lane currently and watching Van Darkholme play bot lane Morde made me try it out myself.

And boy, I was not disappointed!
https://www2.pic-upload.de/img/33174656/adcmorde.jpg

So, before you get out your Pitchforks and burn me at the stake let me run down the Pro's and Cons of bot lane Morde:


#Pros:
-Extremely durable bot laner that counters most dive comps
-Strong bully and outright dirty snowballing
-Can nuke almost any champion to hell and back
-Can heal his own allies
-Dragon Clone
-Strong sieging with his Clone
-Supplements your team with an AP damage source if you're already stacked with AD
-Opens up Top lane for a diver/fighter/tank with cc
-Ganks usually result in free triple kills
-He's Metal as fuck

#Cons:
-you NEED a good Support
-You REALLY, REALLY need a good support
-Some team comps don't really work with Morde 
-Relies on your own experience and you can fuck up rather easily

Honestly, in this meta where Snowballing's so important and where solo lanes usually need to provide CC in order to be impactful Mordekaiser seems to be better suited for the bot lane.
He provides literally everything you'd want from a bot laner except maybe reliable siege but even mid laners like Orianna can provide that.
Also, depending on your support you may want to rush {{item:3146}} if they provide heavy engage (Blitz, naut, etc.) or {{item:3116}}  if they're enchanters with little hard cc and more speedups (Lulu, Sona, karma)

Not to mention bot lane being easier to snowball from as there are TWO victims to get fed off, while also having a defenseless tower and dragon just a stone's throw away.

So, if you want to rake in the free ELO and get revenge on all those pesky ADC's, why not consider playing Mordekaiser bot lane`
It's pretty damn fun and honestly kinda broken in some instances.

-MM

Also, obligatory Sonakaiser clip

OTP confirmed???!
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DPKhyvXKsCg&feature=youtu.be


I'll be answering any questions you may have on the topic of bot lane Mordekaiser, if you decide to pick it up yourself.


Edit:
#Max W lads, can't stress that enough, it's statistically the best spell and there's no reason not to max it.

I have supported quite a few "off meta" picks of adc, but i normally do not see mordekaisers. When i am vs a Mordekaiser in bottom lane, we often beat them..... If my adc has a clue what they are doing at least. Most of the reason Mordekaiser does so well in bottom lane is that until late game, most bottom laners have absolutely no clue what Mordekaiser does apart from "oh he can ghost a dragon and ghost champions"...... 

I was actually told one time when i was beating a Jax top while playing Mordekaiser top that i should have maxed my Q first. Jax's pride and joy is to mess up any and all auto attack based attacks. If i maxed my Q, i would do next to no damage to the jax because he will just dodge it all and stun me and it will be wasted...... However maxing E and W (i normally max E unless vs someone like Riven or Fiora, in which case W or Q to me seems better) results in you beating the jax a lot easier. The jax was actually surprised I even knew that he dodges all auto based attacks......

That aside, yes Morde APC or support should do quite well. Something that i am going to be testing soon is having spell vamp quints for him to help his obsurd sustain..... Although using the exp quints would result in me getting level 2 off the first wave of minions (if he starts W and does not miss any minions) which is a HUGE advantage in bottom lane especially. Been testing that out a bit as well in top or mid.

If played right I have gotten almost solo pentakills easily with him. Actually the two games that got me the S ranks for him i got a penta each time. In top lane, depending on how good the enemy top laner is i normally get my tower by minute 8-10 and start pushing on to the 2nd. By this time the enemy team often sends their mid laner and jungler after me so it helps if my mid laner actually pings..... But even then it can often end with a double or triple kill for me.
